intro: Papaver labradoricum, commonly known as Labrador poppy, is a herbaceous perennial native to the northeastern United States and eastern Canada. It features showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has smooth, dark green leaves that are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a suitable addition to woodland gardens. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ornamental species within the Papaver genus.
